charname: Habit; number of stems at plant base
States: single stemmed, less than five stems arising from the base of the plant, many-stemmed from base
ascending erect at ends, prostrate erect at ends, weakly ascending to erect, erect

Definition: Measure from the boundary of where the white petiole meets green lamina in the central axis of leaf, most discernible on adaxial surface. Measure along central axis or if very curved along margin. Include the attachment surface. On some leaves the end of the lamina is more obvious as there is a pinching in, but not on all. Be guided by green but consider the pinch.

charname: Lamina; margin hyaline section presence (at widest point)

Definition: Measure on adaxial surface at widest point
